page.title: 01GAZETTEER OF SLOUGH EAST
page.content: The area is mainly residential bordered by the Slough Trading Estate to the East and by some farm land to the West.The main A4,London to Bath road virtually cuts the area in two.One of the main features of Burnham is its High Street which is composed of many old and interesting buildings.The village of Burnham was mentioned in the original Domesday Book.The rest of the area is mainly more modern housing which developed after the construction of the Great Western Railway and the subsequent building of the Slough Trading Estate The Estate is one of the largest in Europe.Cippenham was once the site of a Royal Palace but nearly all traces of it have now disappeared.
